dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, you are NOT going to believe what happened in Almaty!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, you are N O T going to believe what happened in Almaty!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, what now? Did someone, like, finally figure out the secret to their famous apples?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, what now? Did someone, like, finally figure out the secret to their famous apples?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No! Even crazier! People were sending in photos of this, like, incredible ring around the sun! A solar halo!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No! Even crazier! People were sending in photos of this, like, incredible ring around the sun! A solar halo!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Residents of Almaty observed an unusual phenomenon in the sky over the city — a solar halo. On the morning of April 1, people in Almaty could witness a solar halo — an atmospheric phenomenon where a ring-shaped glow appears around the sun. Photos of the natural spectacle were sent to our editorial team via the Telegram bot.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa! Wait, I think I saw something about that! Like, a giant, uh, glowy circle?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa! Wait, I think I saw something about that! Like, a giant, uh, glowy circle?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Around the sun! On April 1st, of all days!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Around the sun! On April first, of all days!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On the morning of April 1, people in Almaty could witness a solar halo

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No way! And it wasn't, like, a prank? What even is that?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! And it wasn't, like, a prank? What even is that?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's, um, it’s an atmospheric thing. Super wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's, um, it's an atmospheric thing. Super wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! But not just any clouds. We're talking, like, these tiny, tiny ice crystals, way up high.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! But not just any clouds. We're talking, like, these tiny, tiny ice crystals, way up high.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The phenomenon is caused by the scattering of light on tiny ice crystals in the Earth’s atmosphere. A halo around the sun can be seen when the atmosphere contains high-altitude clouds made up of ice crystals.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Ice crystals? So, like, frozen water?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ice crystals? So, like, frozen water?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, precisely! Moisture freezes way up in the cold, upper layers.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, precisely! Moisture freezes way up in the cold, upper layers.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: These crystals form when moisture droplets freeze in the cold upper layers of the atmosphere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And they just, like, magically make a ring?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they just, like, magically make a ring?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it's not magic, it’s, uh, light scattering. The crystals have to be aligned!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it's not magic, it's, uh, light scattering. The crystals have to be aligned!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The phenomenon is caused by the scattering of light on tiny ice crystals... To create a halo, the ice crystals must be aligned so that their flat surfaces are parallel to one another.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Parallel to each other! So the light, um, reflects and refracts just right.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Parallel to each other! So the light, um, reflects and refracts just right.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To create a halo, the ice crystals must be aligned so that their flat surfaces are parallel to one another. This alignment allows for multiple reflections and scattering of light. As light refracts through the ice crystals, it is reflected and forms the distinctive ring-shaped glow around the sun.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, like a prism effect! That makes so much sense!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, like a prism effect! That makes so much sense!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it just forms that perfect, distinctive glow around the sun.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it just forms that perfect, distinctive glow around the sun.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As light refracts through the ice crystals, it is reflected and forms the distinctive ring-shaped glow around the sun.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That is just incredible. Imagine looking up and seeing that!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That is just incredible. Imagine looking up and seeing that!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! So cool. Just, uh, you know, science doing its thing!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! So cool. Just, uh, you know, science doing its thing!
